records.field_845: You are able to revise using familiar techniques, perhaps ones you’ve used a lot before. Often your revision is passive and you may feel bored, re-reading text books or watching videos. You don’t revise in the most efficient way; you may study the topics you’re already familiar with and rarely push yourself to revise things that you are not sure of. You avoid high-stakes practice under timed conditions, even though you might, deep-down, know this would be good for you. How can you make sure your revision or practice is more targeted? What could encourage you to push yourself outside your comfort zone more?

records.field_845:
Your score suggests that you are working within your comfort zone. You might have made small improvements to last year’s levels of effort but deep down you know you could be working much harder. You sometimes use your study periods effectively; however, you might often get distracted. Quite often, you cut corners or rush tasks, and do just enough to stay out of trouble. You might be quite a passive class member who follows instructions but doesn’t always engage deeply.
How could you involve yourself more in classroom learning? Are there particular subjects where you need to overhaul your effort?

Mae eich sgôr yn awgrymu eich bod chi'n gweithio o fewn eich man cysurus. Efallai eich bod chi wedi gwneud mân newidiadau i lefelau ymdrech y llynedd, ond yn y bôn, fe wyddoch y gallech fod yn gweithio llawer caletach. Weithiau, rydych chi'n defnyddio eich cyfnodau astudio yn effeithiol; ond, yn aml bydd rhywbeth yn tynnu eich sylw. Yn aml iawn, rydych chi'n torri corneli neu'n rhuthro drwy dasgau. Gallwch fod yn oddefol iawn yn y dosbarth.
Sut allech chi fynd ati i ddysgu mwy yn y dosbarth? A oes pynciau neilltuol ble gallech chi ymdrechu fwy?

records.field_845:
You may feel nervous before assessments or exams. Normally you’ll feel quite confident in your abilities although you could be set back by a disappointing result. You generally believe that you can improve your intelligence through hard work but struggle in lessons can sometimes make you feel as if others are better than you at a subject. When you face a setback, you can pick yourself up and carry on, but two or three disappointments in a week can make you feel as if you should give up entirely.
You may need to practice reconnecting with your previous successes.

records.field_849:
Efallai eich bod yn teimlo'n nerfus cyn asesiad neu arholiad. Fel arfer, rydych chi'n teimlo'n hyderus yn eich gallu, er gallai canlyniad siomedig eich digalonni. Rydych chi'n credu, ar y cyfan, y gallwch wella eich deallusrwydd drwy weithio'n galed, ond gall trafferthion mewn gwersi weithiau wneud i chi deimlo fel petai eraill yn well na chi mewn pwnc. Pan fydd rhwystr, gallwch ei wynebu a dal ati, ond gall dwy neu dair siom mewn wythnos wneud i chi ddigalonni yn llwyr.
Efallai bod angen i chi ymarfer ail gysylltu â'ch llwyddiannau blaenorol.

records.field_845: Currently you may tend to feel quite anxious on the build-up to assessments or exams. You might well feel angry at your situation and with yourself. It’s likely that you will often doubt your own ability and won’t feel very positive, even if you have revised. A disappointing result in assessments is likely to knock you further back. You are likely to feel that intelligence is something that is fixed and that no matter how hard you work you can’t improve. As a result, you rarely push yourself and you might even be deliberately giving up and failing rather than trying. Have you considered sharing your situation with a teacher or tutor?

records.field_845: At the moment you may be the type of person who finds thinking about the future challenging or uncomfortable. It might feel much easier to just ignore it. You might have very little idea what you’d like to do when you leave education and you are probably undecided about university, employment or other options. It’s unlikely that you set yourself goals and when you do you often find that you don’t stick to them. You may feel you’re not in control of your life, and have yet to work out what path you will follow. Are you yet clear on what you don’t want your life to be like? Could you arrange a conversation with your tutor to explore some options?

records.field_849: Ar hyn o bryd, efallai ei bod hi'n anodd i chi adolygu a'ch bod yn defnyddio bach iawn o ddulliau.  Efallai, pan fyddwch chi'n adolygu, mai dim ond y testunau rydych chi'n hyderus ynddynt y byddwch chi'n eu hadolygu, gan aros o fewn eich man cysurus. Efallai eich bod yn dibynnu ar ail ddarllen nodiadau a lliwio fel eich prif strategaethau adolygu, felly mae'r broses yn un oddefol iawn. Weithiau nid ydych chi'n adolygu o gwbl, ac mae'n well gennych gymryd siawns yn y prawf neu'r arholiad.  A oes technegau adolygu mae pobl eraill yn eu defnyddio, nad ydych chi'n eu defnyddio? You may feel bored and distracted when you study, and you prefer to avoid engaging in classes or study periods. It’s unlikely you spend much time with very hard-working students.
Do you know why you are choosing to work so little? What could encourage you to study independently for longer?

Ar y cyfan, rydych chi'n gwneud cyn lleied o waith â phosibl, ac efallai mai felly y bu hi ers rhai blynyddoedd bellach. Efallai eich bod chi'n diflasu a methu canolbwyntio wrth astudio, ac mae'n well gennych osgoi bod yn rhan o gyfnodau astudio neu ddosbarthiadau. Mae'n annhebygol eich bod yn treulio llawer o amser efo myfyrwyr sy'n gweithio'n galed.
Wyddoch chi pam eich bod chi'n dewis gweithio cyn lleied? Beth fyddai'n eich annog chi i astudio'n annibynnol am fwy o amser?

You may feel nervous before assessments or exams. Normally you’ll feel quite confident in your abilities although you could be set back by a disappointing result. You generally believe that you can improve your intelligence through hard work but struggle in lessons can sometimes make you feel as if others are better than you at a subject. When you face a setback, you can pick yourself up and carry on, but two or three disappointments in a week can make you feel as if you should give up entirely.
You may need to practice reconnecting with your previous successes.

Generally, when you set goals you are committed to them, although you might sometimes find yourself distracted or changing your mind. You generally finish projects that you start. You may need to narrow down your options and work on a more specific action plan.

records.field_849: Mae gennych chi syniad weddol dda o'r hyn yr hoffech ei wneud yn y dyfodol, ond efallai nad ydych chi'n 100% siŵr ai prifysgol, gwaith neu hyfforddiant yn y gweithle yw'r dewis iawn i chi. Ar y cyfan, pan fyddwch chi'n gosod nodau, rydych chi'n ymroi iddynt, er bod rhywbeth yn tynnu eich sylw, neu'n newid eich meddwl weithiau. Ar y cyfan, rydych chi'n gorffen prosiectau rydych chi'n eu cychwyn. Efallai bod angen i chi gael llai o opsiynau a gweithio ar gynllun gweithredu mwy penodol.

records.field_845: You are a person with some idea of what you would like to achieve in the future, but you might not give much attention to your career planning, preferring to defer the decision. You might sometimes just ‘let things happen’ rather than take control, going with the flow. You might feel more comfortable not setting goals for yourself and you can find it hard sticking to things. What would help you decide what you want to achieve in the future? Have you spent some quality time actively considering your options?

records.field_849: Mae gennych chi rywfaint o syniad o'r hyn yr hoffech chi ei gyflawni yn y dyfodol, ond efallai nad ydych chi'n rhoi llawer o sylw i gynllunio gyrfa, a'ch bod yn well gennych chi ohirio'r penderfyniad. Efallai eich bod chi'n teimlo'n fwy cyfforddus drwy beidio â gosod nodau i'ch hun, ac rydych chi'n cael trafferth cadw at bethau. Beth fyddai'n helpu chi benderfynu beth rydych chi eisiau ei gyflawni yn y dyfodol? Ydych chi wedi treulio amser da yn ystyried eich opsiynau?

records.field_845: At the moment you may be the type of person who finds thinking about the future challenging or uncomfortable. It might feel much easier to just ignore it. You might have very little idea what you’d like to do when you leave education and you are probably undecided about university, employment or other options. It’s unlikely that you set yourself goals and when you do you often find that you don’t stick to them. You may feel you’re not in control of your life, and have yet to work out what path you will follow. Are you yet clear on what you don’t want your life to be like? Could you arrange a conversation with your tutor to explore some options?

records.field_849: Ar hyn o bryd, efallai eich bod chi'r math o berson sy'n ei chael hi'n anodd meddwl am y dyfodol.  Efallai nad oes gennych fawr o syniad o'r hyn hoffech wneud ar ôl gadael addysg, ac mae'n debyg nad ydych chi wedi penderfynu am brifysgol, waith neu opsiynau eraill. Mae'n annhebyg eich bod chi'n gosod nodau i'ch hun, ond pan wnewch chi, fe welwch nad ydych chi'n cadw atynt.  Efallai eich bod yn teimlo nad oes gennych reolaeth ar eich bywyd, ac nid ydych yn gwybod pa lwybr i'w ddilyn eto. A ydych chi'n glir eto sut fywyd nad ydych chi'n ei ddymuno?  Allech chi drefnu cael sgwrs efo'ch tiwtor i edrych ar rai opsiynau?
